text: It would be cool if there was a variant of `autolimits!` called `growlimits!` that worked the same way but wouldn’t shrink the limits. Useful for plots that are being updated but you don’t know the full limits a priori.

text: Like currently I use callbacks in my program to update my observables as the code is running. I generally don’t know what the limits should be, but I call `autolimits!(axis)` in my callback so that the plot limits match the current data. But if the y range shrinks from iteration `i` to `i + 1`, then `autolimits!` would shrink the lims. In the `growlimits!` variant, it would only use the newly calculated limits if the range increased but ignore if it decreased.
